intro: Astrantia ceretanica, commonly known as the Meadowdrop, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom in late summer. Astrantia ceretanica prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
